Authors:
Shohei Fujimori, Junichi P. Abe, Izumi Okane, Yuichi
Yamaoka
Title:
Three new species in the genus Epulorhiza isolated from
orchid mycorrhiza of Spiranthes sinensis var. amoena f. amoena
(Orchidaceae)
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, orchid mycorrhiza, Epulorhiza, Tulasnella,
Spiranthes sinensis var. amoena
Abstract:
Epulorhiza spp. were isolated from Spiranthes sinensis
var. amoena f. amoena, a Japanese native winter green terrestrial orchid
collected at Tsukuba city, Ibaraki Pref., Japan. These isolates were
classified in four morphotype by morphological characters, shape of
monilioid cells and branch type of monilioid cell-chains. On the other
hand, these isolates were classified in five clades by molecular
phylogenetic analysis used by the rDNA 5.8S and D1/D2 region. The
isolates that form four morphotypes and five clades were fitted.
Additionally, these five group were differed their physiological
characters. Thus, E. repens and three new species, E. dendritica sp.
nov., E. ellipsoidea sp. nov. and E. cumulopuntioides sp. nov. were
recognized in this study. This study built new definition of type of
monilioid cell-chain as taxonomical characters. And this study showed
species diversity of orchid mycorrhizal fungi in the genus of Epulorhiza
of S. sinensis var. amoena f. amoena, so far bereaved that was only one
species E. repens.
